definitions.definition: A circular wooden vessel, made of hooped staves.
A kind of basket made especially from straw of rushes, especially for holding fish; by extension, the contents of such a basket or similar container, used as a measure of weight.
A collection of items forming the equipment of a soldier, carried in a knapsack.
Any collection of items needed for a specific purpose, especially for use by a workman, or personal effects packed for travelling.
definitions.example: Always carry a good first-aid kit.

definitions.definition: A collection of parts sold for the buyer to assemble.
definitions.example: I built the entire car from a kit.

definitions.definition: The set of skills and abilities chosen for a playable character.
The standard set of clothing, accessories and equipment worn by players.

definitions.example: Get your kit off and come to bed.

definitions.definition: A full software distribution, as opposed to a patch or upgrade.
To assemble or collect something into kits or sets or to give somebody a kit. See also kit out and other derived phrases.
definitions.example: We need to kit the parts for the assembly by Friday, so that manufacturing can build the tool.

definitions.definition: A very small long-necked violin that came in a variety of shapes and configurations, meant to be carried in a pocket and intended for instructors (dancing masters) to carry to accompany their students.
A school of pigeons, especially domesticated, trained pigeons.
